div.p: VPRS 4363/PO/4/80-22, unregistered inward correspondence, VA 912 Trustees of the Public Library, Museum and National Gallery, Public Record Office, Victoria.

It has occurred to my mind, dear Mr Newbery, that an important addition to the display of Victorian vegetable products in the Exhibition
International Exhibition, Melbourne, 1880-1. might be made, if the trustees of the technologic Museum would allow, that the timber specimens, volotile oils, potash-samples, tars, acids, wood-alcohol &c. were sent on loan to the Exhibition. Even if some of the shelves in the technologic Museum were empty for a few months, it would be better, than having the vegetable resources of the colony less seen, where now a multitude of visitors will crowd together. The trustees of the technologic Museum would be themselves the exhibitors.

div.p:
The temporary transfer of the above mentioned articles ought to involve not much expense.
Newbery referred M's suggestion to the Trustees' Museum Committee on 4 October 1880, where it was 'declined'.
